snippet: After being told he would have to accept less to build a winning team at the Garden, Carmelo Anthony was reportedly offered a maximum contract by the team president Phil Jackson — $129 million over five years.
abstract: New York Knicks president Phil Jackson tells star forward Carmelo Anthony he would be willing to give him a maximum contract worth about $129 million over five years, apparent departure from Jackson's earlier assertions that Anthony would need to take less money for Knicks to build a championship-caliber team.
lead_paragraph: After being told he would have to accept less to build a winning team at the Garden, Carmelo Anthony was reportedly offered a maximum contract by the team president Phil Jackson — $129 million over five years.

headline.main: In Reversal of Earlier Strategy, Knicks Ply Anthony With Cash
headline.print_headline: In Reversal of Earlier Strategy, Knicks Ply Anthony With Cash
